ProjectTitle: Deciphering the epigenetic cross-talk between the (hypoxic) tumor micro-environment and tumor-associated macrophages
InitialFeedbackHistory:
05/07/2022
2. Data: you don't have to list your own manuscripts in a DMP
3. Ethics: will you use human cell lines, please note that you now also need ethical approval to use these, for more information see: www.kuleuven.be/english/research/associatienet/ethics/guidance/humanmaterial
4. Metadata: A collection of metadata standards that may be handy for your work are the MIBBI: https://fairsharing.org/3518, for example MINSEQE, MIQE and MIFlowCyt. For microscopy you can consider using OME (https://fairsharing.org/FAIRsharing.cq8tg2). You may also find the arrive guidelines for reporting of animal experiments useful, journals often ask to follow these: https://arriveguidelines.org/
7. Sharing: Have you considered any specific data repositories for sharing, maybe those from EBI (www.ebi.ac.uk/submission/)? Reading the submission guidelines of candidate repositories may help you to decide which metadata to collect along with your experiments
